Microsoft lets girl group 2NE1 do the talking in a new commercial to brilliantly shade Apple and declare "I Am the Best" by using the K-pop hit for its soundtrack. By
												

	Jeff Benjamin Technology companies doing side-by-side comparisons in TV ads is nothing new. But subtly shading your competition by soundtracking the ad with a foreign language hit is rather brilliant. For its new Surface Pro 3 tablet laptop, Microsoft shows where its product excels compared to the Macbook Air. The ad never comes out and says it, but by synching a song from K-pop group 2NE1, Microsoft is declaring “I am the best” …in Korean, that is. Explore

See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news See latest videos, charts and news   One of 2NE1’s signature and fiercest tracks, “I Am the Best” is a cocky anthem to celebrate all the things to love about oneself. With more than 96 million views on YouTube, the dance-rap-pop hybrid is one of the most-viewed vids ever for a K-pop act and had itself a pop culture moment Stateside when the girls performed it on “The Bachelor” earlier this year.
